page.title: 11POLICING RIPPINGALE
page.content: Until 15 years ago,villages had their own policemen.Today,{policing of the {district}is centralised.This area forms one of 16 parishes policed by 2 officers stationed at Billingborough. Superimposed on these officers is an {Incident Response Vehicle}stationed at Bourne for immediate deployment to incidents.Sub-divisional control is based at Grantham;Stamford is the section station responsible for Billingborough.Emphasis is based on the{reassurance beat officers}who police the area for community involvement and attend local council meetings etc.The area has 16 hour police cover by the reassurance officers who use a vehicle and also patrol villages on foot.This promotes {community contact,}reassures the public and offers attention to even the smallest problem.
